results.title: The Road to Charlie
results.creator_credit: Stuart Barry, Frank Bagnall, Zoran Janjic, Film Australia and Hanna-Barbera Productions
results.brief_description: Made for the Australian Department of Health, this animated film is part of the national drug education campaign. It attempts to show the difficulties of being a teenage individual in the world of group pressures and advises its young audience to look closely at the pressures to conform and carefully to assess their value. Written by Anne Brooksbank, animation by Stuart Barry.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Stuart Barry, Frank Bagnall, Zoran Janjic, Film Australia and Hanna-Barbera Productions

results.title: Betty: a shop steward
results.creator_credit: Linda Blagg, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
Betty, from a Scottish working-class background, is a shop steward who plays a strong role in improving conditions at the factory in which she works. Intended to look critically and personally at the stereotype of the “pommy troublemaker” unionist, the film also raises other questions about working women.

results.title: Ka Rorn: southern village
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson, John Morris, Thanom Soongnarata and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our Asian Neighbours: Thailand”.
At 3am the village of Ka Rorn comes to life and work begins. Produce must be taken to market in Phuket, the only major town on the island. Ka Rorn is a tight, relaxed, self-sufficient community of about 30 families. The people grow coconuts and fruit to sell in the market but, being an island village, fishing is the most lucrative industry.

results.title: Disco
results.creator_credit: Phil Noyce, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Growing Up”.
This film considers social and sexual expectations and attitudes of teenagers attending a disco. Their perceptions of male and female roles, the similarities and differences are portrayed through their behaviour, conversation and dress. Cinematography by Mike Edols.

results.title: Flamingo Park
results.creator_credit: Lindsay Frazer, Clytie Jessop, Australian Film Commission and Women's Film Fund (Australia)
results.brief_description: Shows the works of two artistic and talented Australian fashion designers. Jenny Kee’s colourful designs are inspired by the tones of the bush, birds and flora, whilst Linda Jackson’s inspiration comes from the ocean and the sealife. Jenny’s designs are made up into outstandingly colourful handknitted garments, whilst Linda uses chiffons, cottons and appliqued designs.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lindsay Frazer, Clytie Jessop, Australian Film Commission and Women’s Film Fund (Australia)

results.title: Thirst
results.creator_credit: Graham Chase, Robin Hughes and Film Australia
results.brief_description: One of three films as part of the National Drug Education Program which take an in-depth view of drug addiction in the day-to-day lives of ordinary people. Bob, a travelling salesman in children’s wear is an alcoholic. Although his is a loving family, his drinking and gambling cause his wife great stress and anguish. His drinking leaves him with little or nothing for housekeeping and expenses as he often “drinks” away his wages. Bob wants to lead a normal life and “tomorrow he’ll be sober”, but for him, tomorrow never comes. Photography by Dean Semler. (See also “All in the same boat” T/C 012758 and “Hassles” T/C 012851).

results.title: Brett and friends stick to a job: Brett and Greg
results.brief_description: This tape contains two programs entitled “Brett and Friends - Why stick to a job?” and “Brett and Greg - what are the options?” Brett and friends sets the context for Brett and Greg and should be viewed first. The two programs represent the viewpoints of Brett and Greg and their friends, some of whom had been unemployed for several months at the time of taping

results.title: Who Does the Sentence?
results.creator_credit: Mark Laidler, Peter Johnson, Coburg State College and Victorian association for the care and resettlement of offenders
results.brief_description: When a person is taken into custody, the family of the offender serve “a sentence” of another kind. The Victorian Association for the Care and Rehabilitation of Offenders (VACRO) tries to help these families in its own individual fashion. The film is noted for scenes actually filmed in Pentridge

results.title: Glenn's story
results.creator_credit: Arnold Zable, Sue Dunstan and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: A documentary based on a story written by a 15 year old boy in the maximum security section of Turana. Discusses his childhood and the events which eventually lead to his becoming a ward of the state and finding himself on the wrong side of the law.

results.title: Mining men
results.creator_credit: Lilias Fraser, Norman Castle and Conzinc Riotinto of Australia
results.brief_description: Describes the opportunities available for young men in the mining industry. It outlines the work of the graduate geologist, the mining engineer, the metallurgist and others and gives a comprehensive picture of life and work in new and developing mining communities of Australia.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lilias Fraser, Norman Castle and Conzinc Riotinto of Australia
